page.title: 14OLD PEOPLE 2.
page.content: Most of the{old people}at the home we visited{worked at the mills.}They worked from 6.00am to 7.00pm.One old lady worked at a mill on{Sterling St.} She earned{30 shillings}but another old lady only earned 12 shillings which is now 60p.This isn't worth as much as you can imagine. When the{2nd World War}broke out some of the children had to{stop working}in the mills instead they worked more locally.{Mrs.Hughes}for instance worked in a{confectioners.}All the young men went to fight in the war and all the{older men}helped in the{Home {Guard.}Their job was to{look after}the women and children.They were like policemen,firemen and ambulance men all in one.When the{war ended}there were big{celebrations}with the family. They also had{street parties.
